H0.text: A ruler is the most helpful tool for a scientist observing very small bacteria.

H1.text: Telescope is the tool most helpful to a scientist for observing very small bacteria.

H2.text: Microscope is the most helpful tool for a scientist observing very small bacteria.

H3.text: Meter stick is the most helpful tool to a scientist observing very small bacteria.

A4.text: Microscopy is the science of investigating small objects and structures using a microscope.

A5.text: The performance of a compound light microscope depends on the quality and correct use of the condensor lens system to focus light on the specimen and the objective lens to capture the light from the specimen and form an image.
